title: Honey Walnut Shrimp
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
method: Step 2: Stir water and sugar together in a small saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil and add walnuts. Boil for 2 minutes, then drain and place walnuts on a cookie sheet to dry.
Step 3: Whip egg whites in a medium bowl until foamy. Stir in mochiko until it has a pasty consistency.
Step 4: Heat oil in a heavy deep skillet over medium-high heat. Dip shrimp in mochiko batter, then fry in batches in hot oil until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Step 5: Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Step 6: Stir together mayonnaise, honey, and sweetened condensed milk in a medium serving bowl.
Step 7: Add fried shrimp and toss to coat with sauce. Sprinkle candied walnuts on top and serve.
